guide.introduction: Today we'll make a button that simulates picking up and hanging up a phone so you can ignore a call on a land line.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Today we'll make a button that simulates picking up and hanging up a phone so you can ignore a call on a land line.

Relevant parts
  • Jumper Wire
  • Momentary push-button switch
  • Home Phone Wall Wire
Tools
  • Small breadboard (RS : 276-003)

parts.notes: I used one from an old mouse, but you can reconfigure to use a normal push button.
I don't really know what to call it. It's the wire that plugs into the home phone and the wall.

lines.text: First, strip the phone cable so that the  wire is stripped to the point that the two within are stripped too. Attach to the bread board.
lines.text_raw: First, strip the phone cable so that the  wire is stripped to the point that the two within are stripped too. Attach to the bread board.

guide.summary: Have you ever heard the phone ring and look at the caller ID and want to ignore the call? Well today we'll be taking advantage of a simple connection that will allow us to get rid of that annoying caller.
guide.title: Land Line Phone Call Rejection Button
